alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Rockdale (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:13AM EST until January 11 at 1:46AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River at Gees Mill Road affecting Rockdale and Newton Counties. Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia affecting DeKalb and Rockdale Counties. For the Yellow River Basin...including Suwanee, Lawrenceville, Plantation Rd Lawrenceville, Lilburn, Tanglewood Drive Snellville, Snellville, Snellville, Silver Hill Rd Stone Mtn, Lithonia, Stone Mountain, Lee Road below Snellville, Lithonia, Lithonia, Lithonia, Milstead, Gees Mill Road, Snellville, Loganville, Milstead, Milstead, Milstead, Rocky Plains...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding continues and expands further into the woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Pleasant Hill Road. In Dekalb County... some flooding of backyards of homes begin on Harmony Hills Drive and Court. Johnson Creek flowing under Union Grove Road into the river begins to back up. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:47 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:47 AM EST Wednesday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 10/12/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
